Meet our team!

Faculty Members

Filippo Maria Bianchi

Filippo is an Associate Professor at the Dept. of Mathematics and Statistics. His research focuses on machine learning for time series and graphs.

Benjamin Ricaud

Benjamin is an associate professor at the physics department in the Machine Learning group. His main research topics are Graph signal processing, Methods for exploring large graphs (web and social networks), Graphs in biology, Machine learning in audio and explainable AI, Sparsity in data and models.

PhD students

Michele Guerra

Michele is a PhD student researching randomized and trainable models for time series and graphs. The focus of is research is on uncertainty quantification and interpretability.

Jonas Berg Hansen

Jonas is a PhD student researching pooling in graph neural networks.

Collaborators and visitors

Indro Spinelli

The Northermost GraphML group in the world, based in Tromsø, Norway.
